lines: As a way of earning extra money, a friend of yours suggests that you pose nude for a "Hunks of Academia" calendar being put together by some Business majors. The fee for doing the job is $200.
You are Mr. April. The work involved was practically zero. When the calendar comes out, it creates a major campus controversy. As a result
the calendar is banned from campus and the project goes bankrupt. You do not get paid.
the calendar sells like hotcakes. You are paid within a week after it comes out.
Everyone who posed for the calendar gains overnight celebrity status on campus. You are in high demand for dates.
Your popularity puts a strain on your steady relationship. You and your partner break up.
You would never lower yourself like this for a meager $200. You are too proud--poor, maybe, but proud.
